text:
@thefuriousmoose @TiggerishJen One of my Concerta side effects is a dry mouth so I don’t want to exacerbate that.
Also definitely don’t want my tongue to snap off - how would I talk incessantly at people!

@ADHDhasMe_ @AskADHD Still ok at the mo (bit head-achy) but only got positive test a couple of hours ago.
Only tested because I was heading off to see friends and family tomorrow for a couple of days.
@victoriasansays @AskADHD Thank you.
@danbarua @AskADHD Ahhh! This is what I was concerned about - I can get heart palpitations with Concerta so sounds like I’m taking myself off my meds for a while!
I’ve finally tested positive for the virus! #askadhd what have people done about taking their #adhd meds whilst testing positive? Is there any advice about continuing to take Concerta or not?
What’s worse than losing your cup of tea?  I’ll tell you what’s worse - losing your glass of wine - that’s what’s worse! Why does my #ADHD do this to me?
@adhdadultuk In retrospect peri-menopause was the period when undiagnosed ADHD really impacted on my life.
Hmmm! On second thoughts this evenings schedule hasn’t gone to plan at all so looks like I might have been wrong after all #situationnormal
@ADHD_AHP_UK @adhdadultuk This is so true for me too.

@adhdadultuk I don’t think I’ve ever had a strategy other than waiting for panic and crushing anxiety to kick in which was my normal go-to & not recommend as it’s exhausting. Post-medication for me it seems that my starting triggers are set lower. Do still love a looming hard deadline though!

So instead of staying up way beyond sensible to get more done last night I retired gracefully at 1am (not really late for me) knowing that I wouldn’t be burnt out this morning, would have a clear head and will be able to complete task sensibly.
What has happened to me?
#adultadhd

I think I’m finally getting the hang of this ADHD-awareness thing. I have a time sensitive project. Meds have helped but I can’t quite beat deadline-surfing; old habits die hard and if I’m honest I like that adrenaline rush.
But found myself making the sensible option last night.

I don’t have a cold, and it’s not allergy-related. I think it’s related to the dry mouth. #askAdhd has anyone else experienced this? It sort of makes sense if mucus membranes are dry that this might be a thing.

Just might be overthinking this - thoughts anyone?
#adultadhd

Possible unexpected Concerta side effect #adhdmeds.

I’ve always had the dry mouth thing with Concerta, which is ok with me as it reminds me to hydrate, but I’m increasingly aware of what I would describe as stuffy sinuses - congestion at back of throat and nose.
@BootstrapCook I’ve matured to cheese and strawberry jam!
@BootstrapCook Cheese and tomato, with salt & vinegar crisps for added crunch!
@Richard_Twigg That is an absolutely genius idea! Will make sure my handbag is big enough for the next wedding I’m at!
@Kay11west Just gone looking for the cup of tea I made 15 minutes ago!
@myadhdblog Ahhhh! I’m weirdly obsessive about screen wash so fill it regularly, but the inside of my car is usually a massive tip.
@Yesitsadhd It will be almost impossible to resist the urge to take it! But if you can wait until the morning. Short-acting so probably won’t keep you up all night but it just might …

@daleyjones1 @adhdadultuk I think academic achievement often ‘helps’ mask ADHD.  Certainly worked for me right up until my PhD where a shortage of hard deadlines left me wallowing in a sea of indecision and procrastination.
@adhdadultuk So my AHDH has led me to listening to back to back podcasts from you guys!
@atypicalhippy A ‘list’ because that’s what everyone tells us we need
@Mollys_ADHD I’m excellent at routine! I invent new ones nearly every day!

Newest procrastination behaviour - putting off taking concerta because work task is no longer new and fun - it’s now boring and repetitive, and I don’t want to do it. Got to get it done though - just need appropriate level of panic first. #adhdlife at its best #selfsabotage
@DrAndersIngram Congratulations on your new way forward. The ‘system’ is so wrong but it sounds like you have found something where you can use your talents and you, and they, will be appreciated.

Started new work project! Have rediscovered my hyper-focus. I’ve missed it - going to harness it whilst I can but forgotten quite how knackering it can be.
Apparently told Himself that I just needed to save a file and I’d be there …. 2 hours later ‘have you saved that file yet?’
@staceyiona @ADHDdesigner But it since turns out that I was distracted by many other@things and it has all sat in the machine waiting to come out to dry for hours 🙄
@WhatTheADHD https://t.co/CbGdwerCQc
@staceyiona @ADHDdesigner This has just sent me off to check if I’d actually pressed start on the washing machine! I had (this time!)
@ADHDdesigner Have you tried meditating? 😂

@Norfolk_Mum_3 Reminded me of call from school to say son had swallowed a button off his blazer! He was probably 12 at the time so not toddler swallowing button. I believe nature took its course - we didn’t bother checking!

@AAMumofNDKids If person responsible for maintaining wretched chart also has ADHD the process is completely doomed. Won’t work for parent or child; simply no reward for either. It’s a boring, time-consuming, low-reward process. Although satisfying to add stickers ready for ‘inspection’ #btdt
@AdeyAitchdee Well I was going to but surprisingly (???) I got over-focussed on something else and missed it!

Hoorah! I have an editing contract. Wondering how much difference Concerta will make to the levels of focus & concentration required for editing; I’ve only done this free-style before and have always found it superexhausting to just stay on track. Thoughts? #askadhd #academicadhd
@_pundmc You should learn to meditate!
@AdhdConsistent1 @adamuelma @AskADHD 💯percent!

@ScanlanWithAnA @AdhdConsistent1 Oh hell - This why I can’t ever make my fortune with BitCoin. Don’t they let you reset your password? I must reset a password for one thing or another at least one way a week. And yes I do actually have a list ……
Somewhere!

@AdhdConsistent1 It’s just another example of the ways that ADHD sucks time away! I’m finally starting to recognise when it happens to me, and knowing that makes such a difference, and the ability to walk away even more so. Well done.

@AdhdConsistent1 Just saw this - hope you left your desk and still aren’t sat their fretting about not doing the thing!
It will all still be there after the weekend anyway so you might as well step away.

@Yesitsadhd @ADHDdesigner I had private diagnosis but agreed ‘shared-care’ with my gp. Now I’ve finished titration on ADHD meds gp is happy to take over issuing of prescriptions. I haven’t had to get a separate NHS diagnosis but settling on appropriate dose took a while of paying for private scripts.
@smalltruths @adhdadultuk I was going to send you this links too, but somehow or other I got distracted and didn’t! I wonder why that was 😆

Been busy making some major life-decisions this month but have recognised that my new knowledge of #adultadhd is helping to keep things smooth. Super organising skills now required so fingers-crossed for some hyper-focus #adhd
@AdeyAitchdee William Morris’ News from Nowhere springs to mind.

@HackingADHD Definitely better! My husband described me as seeming to be comfortable in my own skin for the first time ever! I loathe admitting he’s ever right, but in this instance the ‘knowing’ has been transformative (after an initial period of adjustment).
@AdeyAitchdee That just makes me want one more!
@GerardCoen @GeraintWorks Surely arriving before 30 minutes late is so rude!

@GeraintWorks Having grown up hearing this through my childhood I still don’t get why people don’t understand this phrase 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 
Also it has perfect understanding for those of us with ADHD - it completely defines my lived experience!
@AdeyAitchdee That’s good to know.

@AdeyAitchdee Didn’t know I had ADHD at the time but in retrospect it’s so obvious in this scenario.
Sorry doesn’t help you in your exam predicament 😞

@AdeyAitchdee This is why I was so thankful when I went back to university, having had a life direction change (hmm - ADHD), to discover that the degree programme was assessed entirely by coursework. 
The premise being that all-or-nothing exams couldn’t properly assess a research-based subject
@HowtoADHD If I think about it a Small blank notebook in combination with alarms on my phone for time sensitive deadlines (eg trains) works for me
@HowtoADHD I find this thread overwhelming! But at the same time am completely focussed on it.

Also I don’t want to be ‘fixed’ as I’m not actually broken I’m just doing things differently to others. Diagnosis has given me some insight and understanding (although I think I understood me all along, but now others can have a chance to do that too).

So #teamADHD I’m simply going to have to get used to this aren’t I? It’s taken me time to get used to my diagnosis and understand what it means for me. I’m not sure I can take the snap judgements and ideas about how to get ‘fixed’ so it might be a while before I tell anyone else.

Aarrrghhh! I finally drew up the courage to tell someone outside of immediate family about my ADHD and got told that meditation might help; on saying I’d tried in past but it’s not for me was told I probably hadn’t been taught properly or was doing it wrong #adultadhd #lateadhd

What I didn’t say, but perhaps should have, is that obviously I’ve been living with ADHD for ever; some of it has been fabulous, some has been downright terrible, it’s all been exhausting, but knowing why has been revelatory. So now trying to keep the fab and lose the terrible!
@AdeyAitchdee I followed back!
@AdeyAitchdee Good to hear that your university course is going so well.

Since my late diagnosis (at 57) last summer I’ve been through so many emotions. I think/hope I’ve reached a calmer stage now. So just wanted to say patience (yeah right!) actually worked for me. #adultadhd is something that you can live with positively
#adhduk

I’ve looked at what I was trying to do; made some positive decisions (even though some of them were hard & I didn’t really want to make them despite really needing to); communicated those decisions, and had understanding in return. Could it always have been this ‘easy’? #askADHD

So #ADHD drugs are not miracle cures but what I’ve realised is that they give me the space for some much-needed perspective.
So many things happening all at once at moment; in the past I would have tried to keep all the plates spinning (and inevitably failed & burned out)
@Mollys_ADHD Oh hell. I don’t want any more types of it to combine - the ones I have already are more than enough for me!!!!!!

@catherinerose80 Urgh! Is there nothing that can done  expedite this although I’m pretty sure you’ve tried already. This seems like just another unfair hurdle that we’re expected to be able to negotiate; I always worry so much about meeting times that the anxiety is often the reason I miss them.
@nappucats How did it go?

@ieatstufflol I loved teaching in HE. Time structure meant that you had to be ready for class/lectures; hard deadlines always work for me.
And interaction with students meant that every class was entirely different and could go off in myriad directions and then be brought back together.
@katieemorann Ginger’s death on Black Beauty!

@nappucats My diagnosis appointment was really helpful. If it’s anything like mine was (and there’s no reason it shouldn’t be as they’re there to help you) you’ll be asked some questions at the beginning that won’t be difficult to answer, and from there everything will just flow. Good luck.

@LorraineMccfly Oh no! Task immobility is one of the most annoying things isn’t it! 
Seems to be the morning for bad starts to the day.
At least I’ve taken my Concerta now. Plan of action - make mug of tea, set an alarm, and hope for a power-nap!

#teamadhd please send happy vibes - bad start to the day without even getting out of bed yet! Husband left home at 5:30 (long drive for early meeting). Been awake ever since - exhausted already! Will probably now fall asleep and miss a 10am on-line meeting!
@annagranta ADHD is not a virus but it doesn’t sound good

@michaelafiorito Have had all of my adult life being undiagnosed until late last summer - I have always found mornings to be hideous. I mean I have done them but kids needed to get to school, me to work etc but always painful (physically and emotionally) - became a pro at masking.
@adhdadultuk Well done Alex! I managed to cancel mine last month. Been paying for it for over a year - downloaded/read nothing. #adhdtax is punitive!

@michaelafiorito I often do this too. Wake up (but not fully sentient) when NT husband gets up, take Concerta and go back to sleep. Doesn’t always happen though.
I know the tyranny of lists but do find if I write a few things down the night before it helps with direction the following morning.

@BurnhamJasper You’re right it is, and I’m happy I didn’t have to do it, but it took me a moment or two to see it that way rather than as an action he taken because I was sure to forget and leave the job half-done. #adhdsensitivity

At least I can make myself a cup of tea to leave to get cold somewhere whilst I re-centre and get my flow back.
Fortunately I remembered to say thank you to him once I’d had a little rant to myself about people doing stuff!

I’ve had a stumble in my #smallADHDwins. One of my small inconsequential but important tasks was to put the Xmas boxes away. Failed to notice I hadn’t fallen over them this morning - husband put them in loft when I was still sleeping. My plan is ruined I tell you - ruined!
@NicketaNicola Since Concerta my socks have never been so organised and folded!

@AdhdConsistent1 Exactly - small but important and not inconsequential. 
#tinyADHDwins are the way forward!
@AdhdConsistent1 Extra importantly I drank the tea whilst it was still hot (still warm would be more accurate).

@AdhdConsistent1 You may take from the mundane things on my list (important though) that I am putting off a writing task that I need to do. But it’s at the end of my list so I’m luxuriating in the hope of its potential to get done. I’m building up a momentum of ‘getting-things-done’.
@AdhdConsistent1 I made a 9:00 appointment (before Concerta liked in), when I got home I cleared away all the Xmas table mats and I’m now about to put a load of laundry on. #adhdtinywins.
@Sabine74253852 @AskADHD External pressure is such a motivator!

@Esthernagle @AdhdConsistent1 Walking is definitely productive, and for me at least absolutely necessary. I’m way less productive if it doesn’t happen, which as I write this now realise is weird because I walk at the end of the day after I’ve done (or not) stuff.

@AdhdConsistent1 I’ve just made a cup of tea. All I need to do now is remember to drink it before it goes cold.
Making headway on my ‘list’ though.
@Sabine74253852 @AskADHD Thanks for asking but not asking for help - just an observation. I have a ‘list’!!!

I have a lot of small tasks that I need to organise/complete today. #askadhd does anyone else ever find themselves walking around the house saying ‘Concerta please kick in - I need you’?
Or is that just me?
Just need to focus on one thing at a time!

@cyclonebrain Although people used to say something like ‘you’re so ditzy you must really be blonde’! This was a long time ago and I hope people don’t use that stereotype anymore. Anyway turns out not ditzy just undiagnosed ADHD before people knew what it was! Sadness is I listened to them!

@tpwk_mercy @AskADHD I have noticed that I drink far less coffee/tea during the day since I started Concerta but I definitely like a good coffee late afternoon which links up with my afternoon Concerta-slump! But other than that no significant interaction!
@cyclonebrain Hmm! That seems so reminiscent of school days with the exception of not being blonde!

@spaceandweather You have nothing to apologise for. Time spent with family is important and it’s good you to take some clear time from your thesis.
Your advisor should know this!

But 2022 is going to bring a new canine-friend into my life for fun, games, good outside walks (whatever the weather), and a wagging tail when I come through the front door. At this moment in time I couldn’t be happier.

My old undiagnosed-ADHD life had some sort of order imposed on it by having a dog (and by the routine of getting kids to school etc). Our beautiful family dog died 4 years ago and I’ve missed him terribly (also children now left home).
Also please feel free to applaud the fact that I actually had a hot drink that I managed to not lose before it went cold!

Life lesson #10747748
Do not wash down your fish oil capsules with a hot drink.
Yuk! https://t.co/k0Qq1DAclg
@LorraineMccfly Wrapping is overrated!
@Saraheboon It’s the finally-makes-sense that has helped me. Still myself but in a much less over-whelming way these days!
@soundcube One cold tea and an abandoned mug of water so far! I must remember to hydrate!
@soundcube How well my day is going is quantified by how many cups of tea I lose in one day!

Good Sense of direction anyone? Mine is shocking. I’ve realised that I run through a route in my head as I get in the car, even when it’s somewhere I’ve been hundreds of times - often still go wrong! #askADHD Is this an #adhd thing?
@illyr87 The best thing about tomorrow is that there’s another tomorrow following closely behind so everything can be accomplished tomorrow. This is how my life goes 😂
@illyr87 What new hell is this! You mean I can’t do all the things that I’ve moved into the l-can-do-it-all-tomorrow-slot in the 24 hours that are tomorrow!
@BurnhamJasper Definitely a thing!

@BurnhamJasper I’ve been reviewed every new prescription, but took the private clinic route. Have decided with psych just today that dosage of Concerta is now stable, after four months, and am being handed over to GP for continuing prescriptions. 
I have some anxiety over how this will work!
@ADHDdesigner I’ve found that life with ADHD meds is less exhausting! Still exhausting but somehow less so!

I think I’m so struggling with the uncertainty (and desperately hoping that offspring and parents will be here for Xmas) that I can only focus on things that are, in reality, inconsequential rather than actually practical.

So many things to do to get ready for offspring coming home for Xmas (virus allowing). But planning has taken a backseat whilst I’ve reorganised & sorted through 20+ years worth of accumulated bedding! Not sure about feeding everyone but at least they’ll have organised bedding! https://t.co/tfrxNtHCVY
@AdhdThis @adhdadultuk Reading this and even thinking about Christmas cards is stressing me out! The emergency card thing is going to happen again isn’t it?

@JamesGreenthumb @adhdadultuk I ‘can’t’ do them & NT-husband doesn’t see the point in them. He reasons if he sees people regularly (pre-pandemic argument) they don’t ‘need’ one & there’s no point in sending an annual card to people if that’s your only interaction with them, but then again he doesn’t have RSD!

@AngelaBarnes So many things in hindsight!!!! It’s weird (but not necessarily in a bad way) making sense of your own past life with a new perspective, especially when it actually makes more sense now than when you were actually living though those episodes.

@adhdadultuk Cards!
I declared a moratorium on cards years ago but …
three days before Christmas Day I’ll have a major panic, buy emergency cards, write some of them, don’t post any of them.
Put remaining emergency cards in Christmas box to put away so I won’t have to buy any next year!
@afatscientist This isn’t a shock!
@duttfisch This sounds like a game-changer!
I also forget that I’ve made one within the last few minutes so it’s possible for me to have two going cold at the same time!
Make that four! People wonder how I can drink cold tea - I think it’s because it’s my ‘normal’ I’m just used to it.
Why is it so hard to actually drink the tea that I wanted and made whilst it is still hot? That’s three mugs of cold tea already this morning #askADHD
@RachelsADHD So pleased for you.
RT @FrogandToadbot: “I cannot remember any of the things that were on my list of things to do. I will just have to sit here and do nothing,…

@adhdadultuk How many times have I heard ‘will you just finish one thing before you start something else’?
At least I now know why that’s never going to happen.

@LorraineMccfly I have lots of deeply ingrained habits from masking for so long to unpack, but the meds, whilst not being the perfect solution I was unrealistically expecting, have certainly been a positive.

@LorraineMccfly Three months in & I’m still waiting to see what they do! I think, for me at least, the effect is quite subtle. I know there’s a benefit but I can’t quite quantify it. I’ve handled tricky issues in last month that would have been disastrous in the past and I think that’s the meds.
@adhdadultuk Looks like you didn’t actually forget then!
@EscapedAutie That was like me last night 30 minutes before husband came home after three days away - eeeek!!!!
@ADHDdesigner Also remember to eat. Just getting round to lunch at 18:42 - ooops!

@alexconnerbham @ADHDdesigner @translatingadhd @LobowSpark @adhdadultuk The silliness is the best bit. Informative, informal, and silly! What else could people want.
(Also not too long!)
@ADHDdesigner @translatingadhd @LobowSpark Have a look at @adhdadultuk
@ADHTree Ahhh. That particular combination of #adhd and #menopause can be tricky. My sleep is so poor at the moment my Fitbit appears to have given up even trying to record it 😴
@the_tweedy Ahhh! The naive trust in people! I hadn’t realised this was an ADHD thing but my initial reaction is always to believe in the good in people. Sadly doesn’t always work out well!
@afatscientist @AstonUniversity @indparltrust Stressed just reading that but sounds so familiar and you did it and suit looked great. Hope talk went well.
@theADHDacademic It’s a theory I’ve often tested; hasn’t worked yet but this might be the time it does!
Having learned that lesson I’m now making sure that I’m actually in close proximity to my desk (actually at it is a stretch too far) this morning.

I normally give up when they go wrong but not this time - kept going ALL day - couldn’t stop.
I think this is a sign that I’ve finally got right dosage but the wrong thing was in front of me when it hit. Does this make sense? #askadhd

Since I’ve been taking Concerta I’ve often wondered if it was doing anything at all. Recently moved dose up to 72mg and then I spent ALL of Friday doing Suduko puzzles. I don’t as a rule do these puzzles as I think I can’t do them - turns out I can.
@myadhdblog So relatable.

@DaysAdhd I take my Concerta around 8am; by 4pm I’m totally useless, and hugely sleepy for an hour or so, and then bounce back like Tigger to my unmedicated ADHD-self. Psych has suggested adding a small dose of Ritalin into the mix for the late afternoons.
@acoratherapy @AskADHD The number of times I’ve had to redo something I’ve already done is exhausting! Lost lectures; seminars with missing PowerPoints etc etc. They all get done but ….

@jaywardell @AskADHD Completely get this! Isn’t the first time it’s happened and certainly isn’t going to be the last. I’ve managed to resurrect the main gist of it but sadly my excellent title has gone forever!
@catherinerose80 I knew I should have written it down but was too sleepy to do that. I convinced my half-asleep brain that I’d remember amd promptly fell into a deep brain-wiping sleep.

I’ve been sitting on an overdue conference abstract. Last night just as I was dropping off it appeared as a fully formed thing in my head. It was good! 
Guess what!!!! Can’t remember a bloody thing about it this morning.  It’s not just me is it? #askadhd 
#adhd #academicadhd

@AdhdConsistent1 As a part of this passport confession series this was the first time ever in my life I have renewed my passport without the need for an emergency fast track appointment. Thank you Concerta!
@_i_s_a_b_ That’s always been my model and it usually works. Went awry this time because of things that weren’t down to me!
@mikhalweiner Stressfully super-hard unless guided. But haven’t tried for a long time or since I started meds!

@MyCarpetisDirty And yes we’d leave things that were needed by the door the night before, but we were both capable (and frequently did) of walking over the pile of required stuff on way out! Fun days!

@MyCarpetisDirty One of my now grown up kids (the one with late-diagnosed ADHD) reminded me of this the other day, and how if they went and sat in the car whilst I was running round collecting all the forgotten stuff I’d get really cross and shouty. (We weren’t a quiet household!)

@MyCarpetisDirty I’ve always said that the last minute was the time for getting things done, but for the longest time I didn’t know I had ADHD! It’s sort of easier now I know why. Time to get packed I guess.
@jamesdraper @AskADHD It usually does! Will spend first 24 hours in exhausted heap and then all will be good!

@MyCarpetisDirty It always comes together! Anything left behind can be improvised (apart from passports). I’ve packed at the last minute for years after making sure everyone else is sorted. I weirdly like the adrenaline-rush. ADHD-much?? Good things - I bought some excellent last minute shoes!
I seriously thought I had this all sorted!!! Ever the optimist!!!

In my defence I needed to take an overnight roadtrip to help my parents with COVID-based trip admin, and then had a car breakdown issue on my way home involving roadside assistance recovery and only got home about three hours ago. 
It’s all so exhausting I need a holiday!

I have <12 hours before I’m leaving home for a trip with my husband (and my parents who I accidentally invited to join us). It’s past 11pm here and I need to sleep but I’ve yet to pack a thing! #askadhd how much of this is #ADHD behaviour?

@ReloadedDreams I started with Concerta 2 months ago and steadily increased dosage; about to start on 72mg at end of week.
I’d convinced myself they didn’t make much difference but psych asked if I’d be prepared to stop. No way am I going back to the Before Times which is how I know they work!
@Elysia_Sky @Razziecat1 @PatrickRB @samdylanfinch @SNeurotypicals Ooooohhhh! I didn’t know about the red message! There may be flaws in my cunning plan.
@Adhdokie I’ll look it up! I did manage to get to the post office.

@GeraintWorks Obviously not really - can’t afford it for one thing! It’s been such a long time since I gave up but even now I know it wouldn’t take much for me to start up again so it’s a good thing I can’t afford it!
@GeraintWorks It’s enough to make me start smoking again!!!
#askadhd why does public self-shaming work as a motivator? Off to postoffice with parcel now (sadly in car).

Reasons I can’t go to the PostOffice: 
1 sweater I’m wearing is too warm.
2 there’s a hole in the toe of my woolly tights
3 I need to eat something but I don’t want to eat anything
4 could walk but will end up driving because I’ll leave home too late 
5 cross because of driving
I need to go to the post office before it shuts at lunchtime. I can’t make myself move!!!
@FamilyTrait @JayR_Xx So relatable!

@JayR_Xx Oh yes! Masking without even realising I was masking. Didn’t realise this was different to how people without ADHD operated, but also didn’t even realise that I had ADHD. On a certain level I knew that I did things differently to others but had no idea why/how.
@ADHTree This time renewing my passport was the first time ever in my life when I haven’t had to dash off for an emergency renewal appointment! Meds must be doing something!
@kfabor @AskADHD I’m glad it’s not just me! Anger and Rejection Sensitive Dysphoria is strong over this today!

@MikeRadcliffe83 @AskADHD This has definitely made me think. Certainly when my kids were still at school certain groups of mums wouldn’t actually call me disorganised or unreliable, but over time would distance themselves, and their children, from us! Seldom asked to contribute to any events etc.

@idoxxednull @AskADHD I understand that but what I was trying to get at was how patterns of behaviour that have grown up over a long-term relationship have probably evolved in part as a response to my undiagnosed ADHD.
I don’t think it’s just me that’s going to have to unlearn a load of deep-seated long-standing behaviours since my diagnosis. So fed up with managing other people’s responses and reactions.
I’m quite capable of organising my life - it just doesn’t always look organised to other people! And it’s probably more exhausting than I’m prepared to admit or others can even guess at.

#askadhd. Do those amongst you with a #lateadhd diagnosis find that that people close to you try to infantilise you in some way? Is this just because over a long period of time they simply got used to you being ‘unreliable’?
@ZJAyres Do you know how to assemble the flat-pack furniture? Ruins all the ‘fun’ if you do!
@EscapedAutie Being out is good.
@EscapedAutie Although that’s probably reflective of me having spent hours in coffee shops trying to work, not being able to, and then not enjoying being in a coffee shop!
@EscapedAutie Sit in coffee shop and try to enjoy being in a coffee shop #littlesteps

@kimturner70 @CraigLe25711685 My voicemail message says something like ‘I don’t listen to voicemail - if it’s important that you speak to me call me back at another time’. Only one person ever leaves voicemail now - my mother!

Internet shopping and #ADHD are not a good combination for me. Today I had to drop a note through door of a house I lived in last year to say that a parcel was being delivered there for me and would they please accept it and let me know it’s arrived so I can pick it up. #adhdfail

@adhdwitch Both! Chatterbox/disrupter most of the time until exhaustion takes over and then super-dreamy because brain doesn’t turn volume down easily so keeps going. Meds now helping with the volume control - diagnosed at 57 so lots of deeply embedded behaviours!

Some interesting thought here. My concern is if I move to 72mg Converta will the crash be more extreme? I tolerate Concerta well (no significant side effects) but I’m not convinced that it’s making a significant difference to focus & executive function. Maybe expecting too much?
@jessejanderson Well done on getting far enough to need an extension. I’m still procrastinating opening an email that I know has the deadline dates for a conference paper I’m doing!

The pm #adhdslump has hit. #askADHD Is this because of waning Concerta levels? I had mine at 7:30am so 8 hours ago. If I get a higher dose when I next see my consultant will the effect either a) last longer or b) be more pronounced. 
Maybe at my age I just need an afternoon nap!
@Mellow_Megg But look at all those things that you did do!!!
@Mellow_Megg Ahhhhhh! I was going to put the washing machine on after breakfast. Just remembered!

@Kay11west @adhdocdgirl I always put SatNav on even when I know exactly where I’’m going. I’ve been mocked for this for years but but perhaps it’s been an ADHD thing all along? 
I like knowing it’s there, swearing at it when it tells me I’m ‘over the speed limit’ and knowing what time I’ll arrive.
@AngelaBarnes Mine is now wrong for the next five months 😂

In the UK clocks go back one hour tonight. I was awake so thought I’d stay up a bit extra to see it happen on my phone. Then it didn’t happen when I thought it would so I checked and it’s at 2am not 1am. But now I’m actually sleepy so I’m going to miss it #adhdtime strikes again!

@AjratYllek @lilacnonsense Not so much the lining up but the utter and total uselessness of doing the torturous thing after 2 or 3 days. I’d usually have lost the stickers & later we’d just end up sticking loads on so we could show it to whoever’s stupid idea it was. Who wanted a bloody sticker anyway!
@AjratYllek @lilacnonsense This was me!!!

@lilacnonsense One of my kids was diagnosed ADHD in his 20s & me after that. Teachers used to tell me to use a sticker chart for him. He never saw the point of one and I could never keep it going. Stickers! Pah!
@primaryteachew Diagnosed at 57 here! Has definitely been worth it in all sorts of ways. Explains a lot about my interactions with the world!
@PhDfriendSana Although to be fair it’s all done and dusted now but that staircase was long and steep and never ending.

@PanickedPhD I proofed mine until my supervisor sat me down, ‘instructed’ me to open a new email, attach the file & press send to exam office. My 2nd supervisor then took file & ‘volunteered’ to get exam copies printed. Without that intervention I’d still be checking it today!

@chasing_ling @annagranta From a different angle I qualified as an accountant & worked for one of the big firms.
